comment: Knowledgeable, but terrible for explaining, grading, and being a professor. Death by powerpoint (literally reads/misreads every word), references 4-5 different textbooks, have to re-turn in quizzes for corrected grades that aren't always right even then;quiz material not available besides quick inclass homework not allowed to write down/photograph.

I liked this professor a lot. I think he was an easy A because you do not have any homework that he checks, you get half a letter grade of extra credit for showing up everyday, his test/quiz questions are identical to what he goes over in class, aaaand he drops 3/8 lowest quiz grades. I am only averagely smart and I got a final grade of 99.54. ;)
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Super nice guy. Not always eager to answer questions but he keeps his class as interesting as math can possibly be and is actually a good teacher. Speak loudly when talking to him and put in some effort you should pass this class. Test are tricky bc sometimes they are exactly like quizzes and sometimes they are super difficult but I liked the class

Professor Chu is amazing to take for Prob & Stats and here is why.  First, his quizzes and tests are pretty much directly from the book so if you do the ungraded hw you will get an A almost assuredly.  Second, he allows you to bring formula sheets to quizzes and tests.  Finally, he gives extra credit for attendance and you can use any calculator.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Hilarious--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: This teacher will fail you if you miss even the smallest of instructions. I suffer from severe hearing loss from the military and didn't catch him saying "Students who don't circle (X option) will receive a zero." Test time comes and all things considered I should have gotten at least a 90, but ended up with a 0 because "I wasn't paying attention."
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: The material is not hard to understand, but grades extremely harsh. Several students did not circle a test version (the versions are not printed clearly on the front page, they are on the back of a random page in the tests) and he automatically slams them with a 0 even if they would have made an A otherwise. Note, these are worth 20% of your grade.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Took him in the summer. It was pretty rough, but if you apply yourself he sets you up to succeed.  Hard to understand sometimes in lectures but overall a solid choice.

Professor Chu, is very thorough in what he expects and how he will grade his tests. He does exactly what he says, and all his quizzes and tests were directly from class lectures. He is very clear when he teaches(there's a bit of an accent).He also wants his students to do well in his class, so he always emphasizes the importance being prepared.

Professor Chu is wonderful. He's funny and really wants you to do well. Emphasizes respect. Quizzes and Tests are straight from the HW with numbers changed. It's easy to make a 100. In fact, if you don't, you are just lazy.

Teaches with absolutely no passion. Makes class material boring when it should be interesting. Gives quizzes worth 20% and test and final worth 80%. Test&quiz are simple 10 questions multiple choice. Alot of the time test have mistakes. Don't ask questions bc he doesn't like to answer questions in class. You will have to teach yourself.
